comment.author: 83025347@N00
comment._content: Late March, 1915. The Denver was carrying survivors from the Carib and Evelyn when it was sunk, and the survivors rescued by Megantic and Manhattan. So some of these people survived two sinkings. news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2249&dat=19150401&...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I deduce from that article and the date on the negative that these are the 16 Denver survivors aboard the SS Megantic, which arrived before the remaining Denver, Carib and Evelyn survivors on the Manhattan were brought to New York on April 1, 1915. Therefore, this is probably the Denver's rescued crew. See note under

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for providing the background--quite a story!  We can add some information when we next update the record.
